title: Clang always references system gcc, even if being built with spack gcc
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

Even when building LLVM with a spack-installed GCC compiler, Clang includes the system GCC installation in its search paths:

```console
$ spack install llvm@7.0.1%gcc@8.2.0
$ $(spack location -i llvm)/bin/clang -print-search-dirs
programs: =/projects/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/llvm-7.0.1-avafczo6dbasez3obndejep4rwbmwnrl/bin:/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5/../../../../x86_64-redhat-linux/bin
libraries: =/projects/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/llvm-7.0.1-avafczo6dbasez3obndejep4rwbmwnrl/lib/clang/7.0.1:/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5:/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5/../../../../lib64:/lib/../lib64:/usr/lib/../lib64:/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5/../../..:/projects/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/llvm-7.0.1-avafczo6dbasez3obndejep4rwbmwnrl/bin/../lib:/lib:/usr/lib
```

This is the source of a problem that took a long time to debug, wherein a code that's compiled using both Clang (built using GCC 8.2) for C++ and Gfortran (the same GCC 8.2) can link against both the system-provided `libgfortran` and the GCC 8.2 version, even though all the spack-built dependencies correctly use the GCC 8.2 version!:
```console
$ ldd libSenlib.so | grep gfort
	libgfortran.so.3 => /lib64/libgfortran.so.3 (0x00007f9230507000)
	libgfortran.so.5 => /projects/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/gcc-8.2.0-3gf5hj6qpbqqh44sdsnueyyvbnjtbgnh/lib64/libgfortran.so.5 (0x00007f922f577000)
```

The source of this error is that, even though nothing in my CMake configuration references the system GCC, the CMake link command still links against the system path:
```
-L/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/4.8.5
```
and thus overrides the GCC 8.2 library.

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux node2 3.10.0-327.10.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Sat Jan 23 04:54:55 EST 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Red Hat Enterprise Linux Workstation release 7.2 (Maipo)
```
